key_points: Ukrainian couple Alexandr Kudlay and Viktoria Pustovitova ended their relationship after 123 days handcuffed together.
The handcuffing was an attempt to mend their intermittently failing relationship, starting on Valentine's Day.
They experienced every daily activity together, documented their journey on social media, and gained a following.
Pustovitova expressed her emotional struggle during the breakup and reflected on the lesson learned from their experience.
She missed having personal space and felt neglected despite the constant proximity to Kudlay.
Kudlay, reflecting on the experiment, realized they were not well-matched as a couple.
The couple decided to auction the handcuffs and donate part of the proceeds to charity.
Their separation was made official in a public event attended by Ukrainian TV news channels and a record book representative.
No other couple is known to have remained handcuffed together for as long a period.
Their final Instagram post depicted them standing apart, signaling the end of their unique journey together.
